intro: Calliandra brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed calliandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences composed of numerous small, bright red or orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in warm, sunny climates and is often used in ornamental gardening. Calliandra brevipes is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
